intro: Strobilanthes timorensis var. quadriovulatus, commonly known as the four-ovary strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a unique arrangement of four ovaries, which is a key feature of the varietal name. This species is of interest to botanists due to its morphological uniqueness and potential ecological significance.
